thread.title: River View wins first game of season
thread.title_full: River View wins first game of season

title: River View wins first game of season
text:
River View wins first game of season 9:20 p.m. EDT October 10, 2015 CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
River View 13, Claymont 12 
The Black Bears ends losing streak and earns first win of season against Claymont on Friday night. 
They totaled 184 yards of total offense, highlighted by two long touchdowns. A 64-yard touchdown run by Trace Lingo and a 58-yard touchdown connection between Keith Stewart and Bryar Cox. 
The Black Bears went into the half down 6-0, but the 58-yard touchdown connection of Cox and Stewart gave them a 7-6 lead. That score carried into the fourth quarter, before Lingo's touchdown gave River View some cushion. 
Claimant would score in the four, but fail on its two-point conversion and then turn the ball over on downs on it's final possession. 
Stewart finished 8-15 for 106 yards with a touchdown and interception. 
Casey Turnbull led the Black Bears with four solo tackles and three assisted tackles, while Lingo also recovered a fumble. Read or Share this story: http://ohne.ws/1Ln1bSL TOP VIDEOS
